messages.subject: Re: Dear Abby
messages.msgSnippet: ... Actually it s her daughter. Abby was Pauline Phillips.  Her daughter Jeanne started co-writing with her a while ago.  Now she is on her own because her
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, Alan & Brenda Leonard
<abtleo@e...> wrote:
> 5/24/03 07:35:
>
> >
> Dear Abby is wrriten by her niece. Abby is still alive from what I
> understand, just no longer able to write the column daily.
>

Actually it's her daughter.
Abby was Pauline Phillips. Her daughter Jeanne started co-writing
with her a while ago. Now she is on her own because her mother has
Alzheimer's.
I read Dear Abby every morning on line.
Joanna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dear Abby
messages.msgSnippet: ... Dear Abby is wrriten by her niece.  Abby is still alive from what I understand, just no longer able to write the column daily. Ann Landers died recently,
messages.messageBody:
5/24/03 07:35:

> The deceased sister?
> Didn't "Abby" Pass away? I could be wrong but didn't her sister take the Dear
> Abby column?

Dear Abby is wrriten by her niece. Abby is still alive from what I
understand, just no longer able to write the column daily.

Ann Landers died recently, and her column is being written by two ladies who
were her long-time editors.

I did have a thought about the Dear Abby school column, though. The reply
may disgust us, because we see that GPA isn't a big deal at all. However,
most parents do completely buy into that idea, and as well respected as Dear
Abby is by many people, I don't know that she can get away with *not*
supporting the status quo in this case.

brenda
